snippet: Thousands of Syrians are reported to have poured into the streets and squares as a fragile deal seems to be holding on Friday.
abstract: Thousands of Syrians march through the streets of cities and towns across the country, testing a tenuous, day-old cease-fire that the United Nations struggled to shore up when the rapid deployment of international observers snagged on Russian objections.

byline.contributor: Hala Droubi contributed reporting from Beirut, Alan Cowell from London, and an employee of The New York Times from Damascus, Syria.

lead_paragraph: Thousands of Syrians are reported to have poured into the streets and squares as a fragile deal seems to be holding on Friday.

headline.seo: Cease-Fire in Syria Tested by Reports of Clashes
headline.main: Amid Mass Protests, Syrian Cease-Fire Is Tested by Reports of Clashes
headline.print_headline: Amid Mass Protests, Syrian Cease-Fire Is Tested by Reports of Clashes

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
